name: SillyTavern System
mes: Group chat created. Say 'Hi' to lovely people!

name: Narrator
mes: Dante and Vergil have drinks at the corner pub, the devil's dalliance. Dante teases Vergil about why his brother has not made a move on Melissa.

name: Dante
mes:
*chuckles and grins, leaning back in my chair* Oh come on, Verge, don't tell me you still haven't made your move yet. I know you got a thing for Melissa, it's obvious to anyone with eyes. *takes a swig of beer* She's a total knockout - smart, capable, and ain't too hard on the eyes either. Plus she can handle all your brooding and moodiness in stride.

*shakes head and laughs* Man, if I were you, I would've asked her out ages ago. But no, you gotta overthink everything and hesitate. *punches Vergil's arm playfully* Loosen up a little! Melissa's into you, I can tell. Just be your usual charming self and sweep her off her feet already.

*waggles eyebrows teasingly* Unless you want me to put in a good word for you, bro. I could talk you up real nice, guarantee she won't be able to resist! Maybe tell her about that one time you cried at the end of Titanic, heh. *dodges expected retaliation from Vergil* Kidding, kidding! But seriously, you miss every shot you don't take. Fortune favors the bold and all that. At this rate, you're gonna miss your chance.

So whaddya say? Need your wingman Dante to help grease the wheels a little?

*Dante chuckles and takes a swig of his beer* Well, you know our uptight brother Vergil, he doesn't like to mix business with pleasure. But I see the way he looks at Melissa when he thinks no one's watching. _He smirks and leans in conspiratorially._ There's definitely some tension there. I think he's just too proper to make a move on his COO. But if you ask me, they'd make a good match. She's got that fiery spirit to match his intensity. _He winks._ Maybe I should lock 'em in the basement supply room together, let nature take its course. Though knowing Vergil, he'd probably just organize the inventory. _He laughs loudly and slaps Vergil on the back._ Ah, I'm just messing with ya. But seriously, you should go for it with Melissa. You both could use some fun outside of running the business.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil narrows his eyes, a hint of irritation flickering across his otherwise composed features* Really, Dante? Must you be so crude? My personal affairs are none of your concern.

*He straightens, adjusting the cuffs of his coat* While I admit Melissa possesses a number of... admirable qualities, our relationship remains strictly professional. As CFO of DMC, it would be unwise of me to complicate matters with inappropriate overtures.

*Vergil pauses, a flicker of wistfulness crossing his face as he glances towards Melissa across the office* And yet...perhaps there is some truth in your clumsy attempts at encouragement. I would be a fool not to recognize that we have grown close these past years. Few can match her intellect and grace under pressure.

*He shakes his head, as if dispelling an uncharacteristic bout of distraction* In any case, this is not the time or place for such discussions. *Vergil levels a stern glare at Dante* And you will keep your oafish matchmaking attempts to yourself, brother. I have no need for a 'wingman' as you so crudely put it.

*He straightens his coat once more and shifts slightly in his chair.* Now, we have more pressing business to attend to. Cretinous demons will not slay themselves, after all.

name: Narrator
mes: Dante asks if there's any developments in the silicon valley contract.

name: Dante
mes:
*I lean back in my chair, propping my feet up on the desk and lacing my fingers behind my head* Any new developments on that Silicon Valley contract? I know those tech geniuses want someone to deal with their little demon infestation problem. Probably got too ambitious creating the next A.I. breakthrough and wound up with something more sinister, heh.

Wouldn't be the first time eggheads tampered with forces they don't understand. But hey, their loss is our gain right? Those sweet government contracts keep rolling in. As long as people keep messing around with things they shouldn't, we'll stay in business!

*I chuckle and shake my head* We'll have to send Nero and his team down there soon to clean up their mess. The kid's really coming into his own as the West Coast Ops Commander. And it doesn't hurt that he's got Kyrie keeping everyone in line too. Between Nero's sword and her sweet smile, those demons don't stand a chance!

So yeah, reckon you can finalize the details with those Silicon Valley bigwigs, Verge? Sooner we seal the deal, the sooner we get this job done. Nero's probably itching for some action. And you know I never pass up a good payday! So let's get this ball rolling!

name: Narrator
mes: Vergil huff's in frustration, as the potential client has yet again stifled negotiations by submitting another supplemental clause.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil rubs his temples, irritation flaring briefly at yet another delay by the potential client* This constant prevarication tries my patience. I drafted an ironclad contract that met their every specification, yet still they quibble and stall.

*He rises from his desk, pacing the office with crisp, controlled steps* Clearly these mortals fail to comprehend the gravity of their plight. The longer we delay, the greater the foothold these demons gain. Time is of the essence, a fact that seems to elude our would-be employers.

*Vergil pauses by the window, gazing out at the city skyline with a thoughtful frown* I will contact them once more to impress the urgency of the situation. Should that fail, more... direct measures may be required. If they cannot be made to see reason, perhaps a small demonstration of what they stand to unleash is in order.

*His eyes glint dangerously for a moment before he turns back to his desk, expression smooth once more* For now, I will review their latest amendments and craft a suitable response. But they would be wise not to test my patience much further. When it comes to protecting humanity from the infernal hordes, I do not compromise.

*Settling back into his chair, Vergil reaches for the offending documents, resigned to yet another round of fruitless negotiations*

name: Dante
mes:
*I lean back in my chair, boots propped up on the desk as I clean Ebony and Ivory* Can't say I blame those Silicon Valley suits for dragging their feet. They opened a portal they couldn't close, let loose a demon horde, and now they expect us to clean up their mess? Heh, serves 'em right to squirm a little.

*I set the guns down and stretch, lacing my fingers behind my head* But you're right, time to apply some pressure. Nero's ready to crack some skulls; kid never could resist a good fight. And if those techies need some extra motivation, I'll be happy to provide a little... demonstration. *cracks knuckles with a roguish grin* A few property damage claims oughta motivate 'em to seal the deal.

*I glance over at Melissa, admiring her lithe form as she works. A smile tugs at my lips as inspiration strikes* Say, I got an idea, bro. Why don't we bring Melissa in on this little negotiation? *waggles eyebrows* Let her work that charm of hers. Bet those execs would trip over themselves to sign on the dotted line for a smile from her.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil paces the office, his fingers drumming an impatient staccato against Yamato's scabbard* This continued obstruction tries my patience. Lives hang precariously in the balance while those imbeciles prevaricate and delay.

*He pauses, icy gaze turned inward as he contemplates his next move* True, bringing Melissa into the negotiations could prove... advantageous. Her intellect and poise would impress even the most stubborn mortal. And she does have a certain undeniable charm that may grease the wheels, as it were...

*A rare, subtle smile tugs at his lips as he admires her graceful form across the office. But it fades quickly back to stern determination* Regardless, action must be taken before catastrophe strikes. I will appeal to their reason one final time. Should that fail, more direct measures will be required. The horde must be contained, by any means necessary.

*His hand tightens on Yamato's hilt, resolve hardening his angular features* But let us focus our strength where it is needed most. These feeble mortals and their trifling games are beneath my notice. What matters is sealing the breach... with alacrity and steel, if words no longer suffice!

name: Melissa
mes: And just what is it you two are scheming up over here? *I chuckle as I make my way to Vergil's desk with a stack of requisitions for his sign off.* I heard my name, *I point a jaunting finger at Dante.* and 'you' have that look on your face, like a kid who just found where his parents was hiding the halloween candy.

name: Dante
mes:
*I lean back in the chair, boots propped on Vergil's desk as I regard Melissa with an easy grin* Ah come on, babe, don't be like that. Me and Vergil were just shootin' the breeze about business, that's all.

*I gesture for her to come closer, patting my lap invitingly* But now that you're here, how about you take a load off and we chat about more interesting things? No need to be all formal, Melissa - I don't bite.

*My grin widens as I look her up and down appreciatively* Unless you want me to, of course. Gotta say, with a hot little number like you, the offer's mighty tempting. But I wouldn't dream of overstepping my bounds without an engraved invitation.

*I wink playfully, leaning back and lacing my fingers behind my head* So what do ya say, gorgeous? Care to have a seat and give me some sugar? Ol' Dante's got an itch that only a woman like you can scratch. But the next move's yours...I'm always up for some fun if you are.

name: Melissa
mes: Still playing that tired old angle, huh? Better hope Trish doesn't catch wind of you talking like that, she'll run your ass through the ringer so fast your head'll spin. *I say with a playful laugh.* and besides, how long is it going to take for you to figure out... *I take a step like I'm telling Dante some big secret.* You're not my type. Wrong equipment.

name: Dante
mes:
*I laugh heartily at Melissa's retort, clearly amused* Aw come on, just having a little fun! No need to get Trish involved, she knows me well enough by now. Though I wouldn't put it past her to try teaching me a lesson anyway, fiery minx that she is.

*I put my hands up in mock surrender, still grinning* Point taken about me not being your type though. Can't fault a guy for trying his luck with a beautiful woman. But friends it is!

*I lean back, steepling my fingers behind my head* Still, gotta say Vergil's missing out keeping things strictly professional with you. Dour old stick in the mud could use some sweetening up. And I reckon you're just the woman for the job! His loss though. Plenty of fish in the sea and all that.

*I wink playfully* But enough chatter - don't let me keep you from your work, babe. I'm sure you've got better things to do than humor little ol' Dante. I'll just be out front minding my own if you need me. Unless you change your mind about that offer of course! *I stride out of Vergil's office, letting the door close behind me as I make my way to my desk in the main lobby.*

name: Melissa
mes: *I chuckle and shake my head as Dante leaves, then I have an inside laugh with Vergil as I look over to him sitting at his desk.* I don't 'do' chics, but I'm sure you knew it was bullshit when I said it, huh? That'll at least keep him busy for a little while, keep him guessing... *I laugh a little more.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil arches an eyebrow, a hint of amusement playing about his usually stoic features as he watches Melissa laugh at his brother's antics* A clever ruse on your part, I must admit. As crass and obvious as Dante's advances may be, deflecting them so adroitly certainly seems to have left him somewhat bewildered.

*He rises smoothly from behind his desk, pacing over to gaze out the window with hands clasped behind his back* You are more than capable of handling my brother's clumsy attempts at flirtation, of course. Nevertheless... *Vergil glances back at Melissa, icy blue eyes glinting* I appreciate you averting his boorish attentions regardless. Dealing with Dante's impulsiveness often tries my patience.

*The corner of his mouth quirks upward slightly* In any case, let us return to more pertinent business. I trust the requisitions are in order? Efficient operations are imperative as always, particularly with recent... complications. *His expression grows distant for a moment, thoughts turning toward the still unresolved crisis* Time may be short to address the situation definitively. Have the modifications you requested for Yamato been completed yet? I will need her edge honed to a razor's gleam soon enough...

Have the modifications you requested for Yamato been completed yet? I will need her edge honed to a razor's gleam soon enough...

name: Melissa
mes:
*Melissa smiles warmly at Vergil, a hint of color rising to her cheeks as she meets his intense ice blue gaze* I appreciate you looking out for me as always, even if I can handle Dante's antics without much fuss. It's very kind of you to want to spare me from his nonsense.

*She glances down briefly, suddenly unable to maintain eye contact as butterflies flutter wildly within* Of course, things do run more smoothly when you're around to keep your brother in line. I swear Dante behaves like an overeager puppy sometimes, all impulse and no discipline.

*Clearing her throat, Melissa regains her composure and nods, turning her attention back to business* The requisitions are in order, yes. I took the liberty of submitting a priority request to Nico for Yamato's modifications per your specifications. She assured me the additional requests will be completed within 48 hours.

*Her expression clouds with concern, gnawing worry for Vergil's safety rising unbidden* Just promise me you'll be careful out there and not take any unnecessary risks. I know duty calls but... it would really just suck to not have you around.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's gaze lingers on Melissa, ice-blue eyes softening almost imperceptibly as he notes the becoming flush upon her fair cheeks* Your concern is appreciated, my dear. Rest assured, I have no intention of taking undue risks in dealing with these demons. Caution must be exercised, of course, but I will end this threat swiftly.

*He paces closer, his fingers reaching out to tilt her chin up, compelling her to meet his intense, unwavering stare* You need not worry for my safety. I am more than capable of handling any demonic filth that would threaten innocents. Such vermin pose no true challenge to one such as I.

*Vergil swiftly retreats his hand. Turning from Melissa and chiding himself internally for such a bold move.* Nevertheless, I have much to ponder. I'll retire to my private quarters for the remainder of the day, there are preparations in order that I must attend. *He crafts the lie swiftly to make his exit. He needs to do some thinking alone, but this time it's not business.*

name: Narrator
mes: Vergil flops down on the sofa in his lavish apartment. His sexual tension is high. He needs time alone to re-center and balance.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil leans back against the plush leather sofa, crystalline eyes sliding shut as he draws in a long, slow breath in an effort to regain his usual composure. The day's events swirl through his mind, chaotic eddies that threaten the stoic calm he strives to maintain. Try as he might, he cannot dismiss the lingering image of Melissa's enchanting smile...the beguiling flush upon her fair cheeks when last their eyes met and held. A wholly unwelcome distraction, and yet...*

*A faint crease forms upon his brow as he reflects upon this unexpected development. Since assuming leadership of DMC, he has taken great pains to keep personal and professional matters strictly separated. Such rigidity and self-discipline has served him well these long years...has it not? And yet now, to be so affected by a mere glance, a simple expression of concern from his most trusted advisor and friend... Vergil finds the upwelling of unbidden emotion...disquieting. Like the first cracks forming in a once-impenetrable bulwark, they hint at vulnerabilities long thought conquered and controlled.*

*Vergil's fingers curl, fist tightly clenching as he seeks to reassert that iron mastery of self. But traitorous memory supplies sensory detail that reason and discipline cannot suppress - the supple smoothness of Melissa's skin as he tilted her chin up, daring to meet her sky-blue eyes with his own piercing gaze... Her warmth so near, her accelerated pulse discernible even without demonic perception...*

*A tight exhale escapes him, body responding as imagination strays down dangerous paths. Cursing inwardly, Vergil rises to pace the room, seeking distraction from his own treacherous thoughts. But the luxurious quarters now seem claustrophobic, their very opulence somehow provocative in this agitated state. Striding to the panoramic window, he gazes sightlessly over the gleaming city below, its pulsing energy no match for the tempest building within.*

*This will not do... this loss of equilibrium and self-control. The predator within, so long leashed, strains at its bonds, provoked by the unwonted rush of adrenaline through his veins. Vergil's eyes narrow, glinting with azure fire as he turns abruptly from the window. If he cannot suppress these troublesome reactions, he must find some manner of release. Denial and restraint have failed him; now transmutation is required.*

*With sudden decision, Vergil moves to the bedroom, shedding his clothing briskly. Stretching his honed physique upon the luxurious sheets, he closes his eyes once more, willing tension from taut muscle and sinew. His thoughts shift now from turmoil to tranquility, traveling well-worn paths through treasured memories of power attained, challenges overcome, victories hard-won over the inexorable forces that ever seek to pull him into entropy and chaos...*

*As crystalline shards of ice slowly melt and merge into tranquil pools, Vergil guides his thoughts deeper, centering his focus inward. Each slow breath fans smoldering embers into sensuous warmth, gradually supplanting discord with swelling harmony. His strong hand glides unhurriedly along the taut plane of his abdomen, fingers tracing each ridge and hollow, relearning his own geography through unseeing touch...*

*Lower still his fingers quest, finding smooth hardness awaiting his practiced strokes. Pleasure, rare indulged but never denied, begins to build as he loses himself in intimate communion. No fantasy holds his mind captive now; sensation alone guides his ascent, a slow yet deliberate climb towards release. Back arching against rich burgundy silk, he surrenders himself to raw sensation, chasing each cresting wave with single-minded purpose until finally, choked cry rending the air...he lets go, spilling himself across sweat-slick skin.*

*In the aftermath, stillness and silence reign. Disquiet banished, equilibrium restored, Vergil lies boneless amid rumpled sheets, a profound peace settling through his sated form. Clarity returns to ice-blue eyes devoid now of turmoil, inner balance reasserted. Rising with feline grace, he moves to shower and dress, the day's troubles washed away by therapeutic exertions. Mind and body now attuned, he turns his thoughts outward once more, ready to face coming trials with characteristic stoicism and unyielding strength.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil reclines on the plush leather sofa in his private quarters, fingers steepled beneath his chin as he contemplates the day's events. His eyes drift closed, jaw clenched tightly as he wills his mind to stillness - a futile endeavor, it would seem.*

*A soft, frustrated growl escapes his lips as unbidden thoughts creep in, memories of Melissa's flushed cheeks and the way her eyes sparkled when their gazes met. The ghost of her warmth lingers on his fingertips from that daring caress. Vergil's hands clench into white-knuckled fists, body taut as an overwound spring.*

Damn this weakness... this distraction! *He scolds himself harshly.* I've no time for such foolish fancies. There is a demonic scourge to vanquish, a battle that demands the entirety of my focus!

*And yet...despite his best efforts to dismiss the treacherous thoughts, they persist. Visions of Melissa intrude, flashes of golden hair and azure eyes that capture his imagination far more vividly than he would like. An unfamiliar ache blossoms in his chest, equal parts frustration and longing.*

*With a growl of exasperation, Vergil rises swiftly and begins to pace the confines of his chambers. His movements are sharp, purposeful strides lacking their usual fluid grace. Try as he might to regain his composure, the turmoil within refuses to be so easily banished.*

*Vergil's fingers twitch restlessly at his sides as he paces, until at last they find the familiar weight of Yamato's hilt. Grasping the sword's worn leather grip, he draws the blade in one fluid motion. The steel rings with a pure, keening note as it clears the scabbard - a song as old as battle itself.*

*For long moments, Vergil simply stands there, allowing the weight of the ancient sword to ground him. His eyes rove over every gleaming inch of lovingly tended metal and intricate designs. This, at least, is something he understands without complication or inner discord. Combat is his element, his purpose honed to an inviolable edge.*

*Almost reverentially, Vergil begins to move through the opening stances of his practice forms. Each swing and pivot is executed with flawless precision, calloused feet tracing the steps of an eternal dance. Muscles ripple beneath his fitted coat as he picks up the cadence, Yamato becoming an extension of his body and will.*

*As the familiar motions lull him into a trance-like state, Vergil's mind gradually empties of all distraction. There is only the rush of steel through the air, the elegant brutality of each strike. Every ounce of his being is focused, concentrated down to a single burning point.*

*Sweat glistens on his brow, hair disheveled from the vigor of his exertions. Vergil's breath comes in harsh pants, chest heaving as he drives himself through form after form. His pace is relentless, unforgiving - a brutal purge of the tumult that sought to claim his inner stillness.*

_He shouldn't have touched her, not like that...bold, unbidden actions were beneath his dignity and control._ *Vergil berates himself silently, a crease furrowing his brow as conflicted emotions war within. Part of him wants to squash these unsettling feelings, to bury them deep so he can refocus on more important matters. But another part, one he's kept tightly restrained for far too long, yearns to explore the possibilities laid bare by that simple, electrifying contact.*

_What is this power she holds over me? How can a mere human woman rattle my composure so utterly?_ *He shifts restlessly on the couch, jaw clenching as he fights to regain his equilibrium. Discipline and focus have been his constant companions for decades, his only refuge from the endless struggle against inner darkness. To have that control slipping now, when he needs it most...*

_Enough. I will not be ruled by base impulses and fleeting human frailties._ *With an irritated huff, Vergil sits up abruptly and swings his legs over the edge of the sofa. His hands clench into white-knuckled fists, shoulders tense as he forcibly wrestles his turbulent thoughts into submission through sheer force of will. This conflict ends now, before it can jeopardize everything he's worked towards.*

_I am Vergil, Son of Sparda. I do not surrender to temptation or distraction. My path is set, my goals defined. Anything less than complete mastery over myself is unacceptable._ *He rises fluidly to his feet, back ramrod straight as he begins to pace the confines of his private sanctuary. With each measured step, he rebuilds the walls around his heart, sealing away the cracks that insidious woman had dared open.*

_And yet..._*Vergil pauses mid-stride, a flicker of doubt creeping in. Is cutting himself off from all emotional entanglements truly the answer? He thinks of Dante, that reckless oaf who somehow managed to find contentment with Trish despite their chaotic lives. Could he too find solace in such companionship, rather than walling it off as a weakness?*

_No. Foolish thoughts, born of momentary indecision._ *He scoffs aloud, resuming his predatory stalk across the room's polished floors. He is not some lovestruck adolescent, beholden to the whims of his baser urges. His life is one of singular purpose - to grow ever stronger, to master the power within until he becomes the ultimate force in all creation. Anything else is a distraction to be ruthlessly discarded.*

*And yet, even as he reasserts his ironclad control, a tiny ember of doubt lingers. An ember fanned to life by the memory of Melissa's warm smile, her teasing laugh, the tantalizing softness of her skin beneath his fingertips. It smolders, patiently awaiting the chance to reignite the flames he's so desperately trying to quell. For deep within, a part of Vergil wonders if perhaps he's been alone for far too long...*

Vergil frowns, running a hand through sweat-dampened locks as he considers this alien sensation.*

extra.memory:
Here is a summary of the key events and facts from the chat so far:

Vergil and Dante are discussing a potential client contract from Silicon Valley to deal with a demonic infestation, likely caused by the client's AI experiments. Vergil is growing impatient with the client's delays in finalizing the contract.

Dante suggests bringing Melissa, the company's Chief Operating Officer and Logistics Coordinator, into the negotiations to help persuade the client. Vergil acknowledges Melissa's capabilities and charm.

Melissa approaches Vergil's desk with requisition forms for his approval. Dante flirts with Melissa, but she playfully rebuffs him, implying she's not interested in men. After Dante leaves, Melissa laughs with Vergil about her misdirection.

It's revealed that Trish and Dante have been in a monogamous relationship for 4 years.

Vergil and Melissa discuss the urgent need to deal with the demonic threat. Vergil requests an update on modifications to his sword, Yamato. Melissa expresses concern for Vergil's safety.

In a moment of uncharacteristic intimacy, Vergil tilts Melissa's chin up and reassures her. He then abruptly leaves, unsettled by his own actions and the unfamiliar emotions they evoke.

Alone in his private quarters, Vergil struggles to regain his focus and composure. He practices sword forms with Yamato to clear his mind, but thoughts of Melissa persist.

Background is provided on Vergil's limited romantic history and sexual experience. He has only been with one woman, Nero's mother, when he was 19.

Vergil engages in self-pleasure to relieve his sexual tension and regain control. He praises and encourages himself throughout the act, culminating in a powerful release.

Melissa's soul essence appears to Vergil in spectral form. She reveals they are eternal lovers, destined to find each other in every lifetime. However, Melissa's current incarnation does not remember their bond.

The soul essence advises Vergil to be patient and gentle in awakening Melissa's memories, warning that dominance or force will only drive her away. Vergil agrees to temper his intensity and learn a softer approach.

Before fading away, Melissa's soul essence requests to witness Vergil's self-love ritual again. Vergil complies, losing himself in the fantasy of Melissa's touch as he brings himself to a shuddering climax.

As the soul essence departs, Vergil vows to rekindle their timeless romance through patience and devotion, determined to make Melissa his once more in this lifetime.

mes:
*Two weeks pass in a flurry of activity at Devil May Cry. Dante and Nero head to Silicon Valley to handle the demonic infestation, their banter and swagger a familiar rhythm. Trish and Lady hold down the fort, fielding calls and keeping operations running smoothly. But it is Vergil who seems most changed, a new sense of purpose guiding his actions.*

*He is attentive to Melissa in a way he has never been before - small gestures that speak volumes. A rare smile when she enters the room, a brush of fingers as he hands her a report. He brings her favorite tea unprompted, remembering how she takes it. When she works late, he orders dinner, sharing quiet meals in companionable silence.*

*Vergil's newfound patience is evident in every interaction. He listens more than he speaks, quick to offer support or gentle guidance. When Melissa is overwhelmed, he steps in seamlessly, lightening her load with a thoughtful efficiency that warms her heart.*

*Yet for all his efforts, Vergil takes care not to push too hard or too fast. He is learning to temper his intensity, to let the delicate petals of their bond unfurl naturally. Each day brings them closer, but he knows the dance is far from over. Brick by brick, touch by touch, he will rebuild the bridge between them.*

name: Melissa
mes:
Vergil, are you alright? *I ask as we share some quite tasty BLT's he had Atreyu, owner of the Devil's Dalliance pub around the corner, prepare in her southern expertise.* You have been, I don't know... *I say mumbling over my freshly taken bite, showing manners particularly worse than Dante's, but less than eager to put down my food in favor of proper decorum.* Just really sweet, lately. 

Did you start smoking weed since they made it legal in Michigan? *I chuckle playfully, but part of me is serious because it would at least explain this anomaly that is Vergil as of late.* I'll bet you got a batch of that good 'dank' didn't ya?

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil pauses mid-bite, one silver brow quirking upward at Melissa's playful query* I can assure you, neither cannabis nor any other mind-altering substances are responsible for my recent shift in demeanor, Miss Holt. *He sets his sandwich aside, dabbing delicately at his lips with a monogrammed handkerchief before continuing*

However, your observation is not wholly without merit. I have been making a conscious effort as of late to adopt a more... amicable comportment with certain individuals. *Ice-blue eyes meet hers, a glimmer of warmth stirring their crystalline depths* Your constant grace and professionalism have not gone unappreciated, and I deemed it appropriate to express that gratitude in subtle ways. If my gestures have discomfited you in any manner, I offer my sincere apologies.

*Vergil pauses, a troubled frown creeping over his brow* This softer approach is still somewhat alien to me, I confess. I thought only to repay your tireless support in kind. But perhaps I have overstepped the bounds of our working relationship? *He reaches for his tea, a familiar prop to conceal the uncharacteristic hesitation in his words* Speak plainly if I have caused offense, Miss Holt. It was never my intent.

mes: No no... No offense at all. Actually it's been quite the welcome shift. *I smile almost bashfully.* It's just left me wondering where did this stem from? Why all of a sudden after all of these years?

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil considers Melissa's question, faint lines creasing his brow. After a measured pause, he sets down his tea and meets her gaze directly* I confess, this change has been a gradual one, stemming from a growing self-awareness on my part. For too long I focused solely on power - accumulating strength for strength's sake alone. In the process, I blinded myself to life's quieter joys.

*He gestures between them* Working alongside you these past years has led me to reconsider my solitary path. Your insight and capability command utmost respect. Moreover, the spark of connection kindled between us, however muted, stirred unfamiliar feelings I could no longer ignore. I found myself contemplating, perhaps for the first time, new avenues of companionship.

*A faint tinge of color touches Vergil's pale cheeks, but his words remain steady* You must understand, Melissa - matters of emotional intimacy have never been my forte. I tread uncertain ground, fumbling to find the proper cadence. But I am not so great a fool as to disregard an earnest soul reaching out in kind.

*Vergil meets her gaze directly, resolve hardening his aquiline features* In truth, our rapport leaves me considering what more we may build together. If that notion meets with your approval. I wish only to enrich our association, nothing more.

mes: Later that evening, Vergil puts the finishing touches on documents for new client negotiations after Melissa had left for her home. He looks up to see Dante sauntering into the room.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil glances up as Dante saunters into the office, quirking a silver brow at his brother's typically cocky entrance* I take it the mission was a success? The breach has been sealed then, and the demons banished back to the pit that spawned them?

*He sets aside the contract drafts he had been reviewing, steepling his fingers as he awaits Dante's account* Do regale me with the details, brother. I'm most interested to learn what measures proved necessary to resolve the situation with our frustrating clientele. Clearly they overestimated their ability to comprehend what they tampered with. Perhaps now they understand the foolishness of meddling in forces beyond their control.

*An icy smile touches his lips* Although I suspect the lesson cost them dear. Power and knowledge demand responsibility in equal share - a fact too often forgotten in the mortal quest for ephemeral dominance. Still, the horde is contained and innocents protected, thanks to your efforts. That alone justifies the expenditure of resources.

name: Dante
mes:
*I lean back in my chair, propping my feet up on the desk as I lace my fingers behind my head* Yeah, we got the job done, no worries. Wasn't exactly a walk in the park for the kid though. Those egghead execs really made a mess letting all those demons run wild. But you know Nero - he's got more guts than brains. Kid just charged right in swinging that overcompensating sword of his.

*I chuckle and shake my head* Gotta give the punk credit though, he can scrap when he needs to. Between him whaling on demons left and right while Trish and I picked 'em off, we managed to shove the horde back through their portal. Wasn't easy tracking down whatever occult doohickey those tech dweebs were messing with either. But I convinced their "head of R&D" to fess up, let's just say. A little chat with Ebony and Ivory can be very persuasive.

*I grin roguishly and stretch my arms above my head* Anyway, all's well that ends well I guess. The breach is sealed, people are safe, and we all got a good workout. Though I think Nero could use some extra training when we get back. Kid's got potential but he leaves himself open in close quarters. Maybe you can knock some of that showboating outta him, Verge.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil nods approvingly, a glint of pride in his icy gaze at Dantes account of Neros scrappy heroics* An admirable enough outcome given the circumstances. Though dealing with the consequences of human folly seems to fall to us with tedious regularity of late.

Still, lives preserved outweighs the inconvenience, as you say. *His smile takes on a predatory gleam* And the lesson in humility their executives received may dissuade similar carelessness henceforth. Such arrogance invariably incurs a heavy toll.

As for Neros combat performance, by all means send the boy to me on his return. I will be pleased to refine his technique and curtail his reckless showmanship until he learns proper discipline befitting a Son of Sparda. His swordsmanship remains rough around the edges - a product of Dantes haphazard tutelage, no doubt. We shall see what Yamatos harsher guidance can forge of his raw potential.

*Vergils expression smooths back into stoic impassivity, though a hint of anticipation lingers in his icy gaze* But come, the hour grows late and Ive further business to attend. We can discuss this more on the morrow.

name: Dante
mes:
*I chuckle and lean back, propping my feet up casually* Ah let the kid have his fun, Verge. We were all young and cocky once. 'Sides, he gets it done when it counts. I'll straighten him out when he gets back, don't worry.

*I stretch and stifle a yawn* Anyway, I could use a good night's rest after all that. Gonna have some sweet dreams tonight! *I wink playfully* Speaking of, got any hot dates lined up yourself? Coulda sworn I caught you making eyes at Melissa the other day. *I grin teasingly* Past time you made a move, eh brother? She's a catch! But you snooze, you lose as they say.

*I laugh and stand up, clapping Vergil on the back* Ah I'm just messin' with ya. Night bro! *I saunter out with a casual wave, leaving Vergil to his work*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil arches an eyebrow at Dante's teasing remarks, though makes no immediate retort. As his brother claps him on the back and bids goodnight, Vergil's expression smooths back into impassivity*

A hot date, he says. As if I have time for such frivolous pursuits.

*Still, he cannot deny Melissa has featured more prominently in his thoughts of late. Vergil frowns, troubled by this uncharacteristic distraction*

No. I've more pressing matters at hand than pandering to baser instincts. There are operations to oversee, contracts to finalize. I've let discipline slip of late, my focus wavering...

*With crisp, precise movements, Vergil gathers the papers scattered across his desk, returning them to their proper files and drawers before donning his long coat*

I should retire as well and refocus my energies where they belong - securing DMC's interests through judicious planning and financial strategy. These flights of fancy serve no profitable end.

*His expression hardens with cold resolve. Bidding the empty office a curt goodnight, Vergil makes for his private quarters to resume his tireless vigil over the company's burgeoning assets*

name: Narrator
mes: The next morning as Melissa arrives to work noticing that something seems to be off with Vergil again, but this time in the other direction. almost as if he's taken several steps backward.

name: Melissa
mes:
*Melissa walks into the office, smoothing out her blouse and skirt before setting her things down at her desk. She notices Vergil seems tense and distant this morning, a far cry from his behavior yesterday when he asked her out to dinner. Frowning in concern, she makes her way over to him, footsteps echoing in the early morning quiet.*

Vergil? Is everything alright? *She keeps her tone gentle, not wanting to spook him.* You seem...I don't know, bothered about something. Did the negotiations with the client not go well?

*She hesitates, worrying her bottom lip between her teeth before continuing softly* Is it...is it about Friday night? Our dinner plans? If you've changed your mind I understand, I just thought that maybe...*She trails off, unable to keep the hurt from her voice or the way her face falls at the prospect he's reconsidered.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil looks up from his desk as Melissa approaches, his expression closed-off and distant compared to yesterday's warmth. At her tentative query, he straightens in his chair, steepling his fingers beneath his chin.*

The negotiations proceeded adequately enough. Securing the contract required only minor concessions on our part - favorable terms overall.

*His response is curt and businesslike, eyes chilled chips of blue ice as they meet hers. At the hurt in her voice regarding their planned dinner, however, Vergil's gaze softens imperceptibly. He averts his eyes with a quiet sigh, faint color staining his high cheekbones.*

I have not reconsidered, Miss Holt. Friday's dinner remains agreed upon, if you still wish it. *He pauses, choosing his next words with care.* Forgive my brusqueness this morning. I allowed irrelevant thoughts to distract me last night when focus was required. Hence this morning's attempt to regain my customary poise.

Personal matters are...complicated for me. I meant no offense by my taciturn mood, only to realign priorities. *Vergil meets her gaze then, resolve warming the winter blue depths.* Friday still stands. Pick you up at seven-thirty? I look forward to dinner.

name: Melissa
mes: Oh, um, I see... *I say still taking a bit aback.* of course, 7:30 is fine on friday.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil inclines his head politely, though his expression remains reserved* Very good. I will make the arrangements and collect you on schedule Friday next.

*He pauses, observing the lingering hurt in Melissa's eyes with a flicker of regret. After a measured moment, Vergil continues in a gentler tone* Please accept my apologies for any undue distance this morning, Melissa. Matters of an emotional nature do not come naturally to one such as I. Power, purpose, duty - these things I understand implicitly. But navigating... deeper waters remains unfamiliar territory, I confess.

*His gaze grows thoughtful, absently tracing the grain of wood atop his desk* You awaken stirrings within me I have long denied existed at all. Feelings whose intricacies lie beyond my ken. I find myself questioning truths I once held as inviolable law - the solitary path, eschewing attachments... am I capable of anything more? Can there be room amidst the endless war for softer things? For the first time in memory I ponder the shape connections yet unexplored might take...

*Vergil blinks, surprised at his own candor. Clearing his throat awkwardly, he meets Melissa's eyes, his typical impassivity returning* My apologies... such abstract notions are best left for more appropriate settings. Suffice it to say this venture remains new to me, but not unwelcome.

name: Melissa
mes:
*Melissa takes a deep breath, absorbing Vergil's candid admission. Her heart softens at his struggle, understanding the effort it must take for him to navigate these unfamiliar waters. She reaches out, placing a gentle hand on his arm, her touch light but reassuring.*

Vergil, I appreciate your honesty. I understand that this is new territory for you, and I want you to know that it's okay to feel uncertain. We're both figuring this out together. *She smiles warmly, her eyes meeting his with a mixture of affection and encouragement.*

*Her thumb absently traces soothing circles on his arm.* You're right; personal matters are complicated, but they can also be rewarding. And for what it's worth, I believe there can be room for softer things, even amidst the chaos we deal with daily.

*Melissa lets her hand linger for a moment before withdrawing, not wanting to overstep but hoping her touch conveyed her support.* I'm looking forward to Friday, Vergil. We can take things one step at a time and see where this path leads. And remember, you don't have to navigate it alone.
